text: Keg at the brewery. Clear golden, thin creamy white head, good retention. Aroma of pale malt, grassy hops, a hint of Noble hops. The taste is grassy hops and pale malt. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness. Refreshing, simple, crisp, clean. Nice beer.

12oz bottle pours a clear pale golden with a large white head. Earthy aroma, strong lager yeast, pencil shavings, and grassy hops. Taste of mildly sweet corn grain malt, lager yeast, and bitter grassy hops. A simple clean lager, nice!

Bottle. Clear deep golden body with a frothy white head, rapidly diminishing. Aroma of toasted grain, grass, biscuit. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/sticky texture, lively carbonation.
Sampled at GABF 2016 with Paul and Larry. Pours a light body with soft white lacing. Mouthfeel is light bodied with notes of fresh grass, bready malt, spice, grains and soft sweetness.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow with a white head that dissipates to the edges and laces slightly. Aroma has a good amount of straw, biscuit , sweet grains and a touch of grass. Flavor is similar with straw, sweet grains and biscuit supported by a slight grass note. Crisp.

Draft. Golden yellow with thin white head and some lacing. Not much for aroma, bread and slight citrus. Light body and medium carb. Enough hops to give it a little fruity flavor and crisp finish. Decent lager overall.

Picked up a single 12-oz bottle from Ridgeview Liquors in Green Bay, Wisconsin. Pours a semi-clear golden pale colored brew with a fast dissipating off-white head that leaves behind some spotty lacing. Aroma of golden grain malt, a hint of earthy and grassy hops and a touch of biscuit. Taste is medium bodied with flavors of golden grain malt and some light earthy and grassy hops. Finish has a mild lager yeast and golden grain malt aftertaste followed by a mild bitterness. Overall, a mild semi-dry lager.
Gold pour. Nose of graham cracker, tinny lager malt, some adjunct, and citrusy noble hops. Flavor is lightly grainy malt and citrus hops. Overall, solid pale lager.

Pours a pretty clear darker golden with a good sized khaki head that settles slowly and leaves some delicate lace. Nose involves clean honey and biscuits and English style hops. Lightly sweet, fairly bitter. Lighter bodied, oily, decent action, finishing toasty and biscuity. A really nice, well put-together lager. Has substance and remains drinkable.
Appearance is light gold, has a grainy nose - the body is light to medium with a crisp, toasty malt character.
Draft. Slgihtly darker than usual gold, very malty, toasted malt lager, its decent but not amazing. Soo malty.
Bottle. Pours a light golden copper color. Aroma and taste are light malts, refreshing.

A pleasant smelling lager, and if I didnt know better I might say it reminds me of Bells lager of the lakes. Crisp clean malt profile, well-rested with no off flavors. Nicely balanced and quite enjoyable. Better than the UPA certainly, and a brew I hope to enjoy again.

This stuff---in all likelihood--will not make you vomit in terror. But, it may. So to keep the vomitus to a minimum and forego this junk and get the good junk: BLATZ!

THINK ABOUT IT!
